para.text: Although often you will create elements in a diagram, model elements can also be created without being displayed in the diagram. When created in the model, the element is not displayed in any diagrams. This is useful when more than one view will be created to represent the elements in the model.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Select from the model explorer an element to contain the new model element.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: menu and select an element type from the menu. Or, select the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The new model element will be created under the selected model.

para.text: If you delete a model element, many related elements are deleted together. Please exercise caution because deleting a model element results in deletion of the following elements.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Symbol; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : All model elements included in the model being deleted are also deleted.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : All relations such as Generalization, Association and Dependency related to the model element being deleted are also deleted.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: : All view elements that represent the model being deleted are also deleted.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Select from the model explorer a model element to delete, or select a view element from the diagram area to delete the model element represented by it.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: The selected model element is deleted.

para.text: Model elements can be moved so as to be placed under other elements, such as by moving a class to be placed under another package or moving an attribute to be placed under another class. Model elements can be moved to be placed only under elements that can contain model elements. They cannot be moved to be placed under other types of elements.

list.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Select from the model explorer an element to move.

li.style: text-align:left; text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: Drag the element and drop it at the element that is to contain it.

para.text: The order between model elements can be modified to show intuitively configurations of software model. The order modification between model elements can be only among same kinds of elements. Also, it can be if sort of model navigator is only Storage Order.
Procedure for modify order of model element :

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Select an element to modify the order in model navigator.

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
li.text: Move model element to a line as push

para.text: Elements such as Attribute, Operation, Enumeration Literal which is expressing in Collection editor can be modified their order in Collection editor.
Procedure to modify order of model element in collection editor :

list.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none; font-family:Verdana; font-size:9pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Select upper element of an element to modify its order.
Select tap which is relative in collection including element.
Select element to modify the order.

li.style: text-indent:-13px; margin-top:10px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:35px; line-height:1.0; tabstops:none;
li.text: Modify the order of the model element as push [Move Up] or [Move Down] button. You can modify the order by using Ctrl+Cursor key.

para.text: The structure of models in model navigator can be aligned as saving order or alphabet order. The aligned model is only shown by model navigator, the order among real models are not modified. In order to sort models, click [Align as saving order] or [Align as Alphabetical order]. If change model alignment way, the spreading statue of each node in model navigator is cancelled, and the top leveled node is spreaded.
